sub_topic: Determining the volume of a torus.
message_1: A torus has a major radius of 8 cm and a minor radius of 3 cm. Find the volume of this torus in cubic centimeters.
message_2:
To find the volume of a torus, we can use the formula:

Volume = (π * minor_radius^2) * (2 * π * major_radius)

where minor_radius is the radius of the circular cross-section of the torus (in this case, 3 cm) and major_radius is the distance from the center of the circular cross-section to the center of the torus (in this case, 8 cm).

Plugging in the given values, we get:

Volume = (π * 3^2) * (2 * π * 8)
Volume = (π * 9) * (16 * π)
Volume = 144 * π^2

The volume of the torus is approximately 144π^2 cubic centimeters. To get a numerical value, we can use the approximation π ≈ 3.14159:

Volume ≈ 144 * (3.14159)^2
Volume ≈ 144 * 9.8696
Volume ≈ 1421.69 cubic centimeters

So, the volume of the torus is approximately 1421.69 cubic centimeters.
